Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured bowl; interior glazed; band of alternating red/black/white/black incised tongues above added red band lined in white; below incised lotus flower and bud frieze with rich added colour. Exterior slipped dull white; from the top: maeander band; band with added red banmd lined in white; goat grazing to right; metopal band of crosses, squares and sets of four verticals between bands with added red bands lined in white; part of two goats running left, one with head turned back.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.558)
